camel.source.path.fileSystemName.name: camel.source.path.fileSystemName
camel.source.path.fileSystemName.description: name of filesystem to be used

camel.source.endpoint.close.name: camel.source.endpoint.close
camel.source.endpoint.close.description: Whether or not a file changed event raised indicates completion (true) or modification (false)

camel.source.endpoint.closeStreamAfterRe.name: camel.source.endpoint.closeStreamAfterRead
camel.source.endpoint.closeStreamAfterRe.description: check for closing stream after read

camel.source.endpoint.dataCount.description: count number of bytes to download

camel.source.endpoint.directoryName.description: directory of the file to be handled in component

camel.source.endpoint.fileDir.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileDir
camel.source.endpoint.fileDir.description: directory of file to do operations in the local system

camel.source.endpoint.fileName.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileName
camel.source.endpoint.fileName.description: name of file to be handled in component

camel.source.endpoint.fileOffset.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileOffset
camel.source.endpoint.fileOffset.description: offset position in file for different operations

camel.source.endpoint.maxResults.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxResults
camel.source.endpoint.maxResults.description: maximum number of results to show at a time

camel.source.endpoint.maxRetryRequests.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxRetryRequests
camel.source.endpoint.maxRetryRequests.description: no of retries to a given request

camel.source.endpoint.openOptions.name: camel.source.endpoint.openOptions
camel.source.endpoint.openOptions.description: set open options for creating file

camel.source.endpoint.path.name: camel.source.endpoint.path
camel.source.endpoint.path.description: path in azure datalake for operations

camel.source.endpoint.position.name: camel.source.endpoint.position
camel.source.endpoint.position.description: This parameter allows the caller to upload data in parallel and control the order in which it is appended to the file.

camel.source.endpoint.regex.name: camel.source.endpoint.regex
camel.source.endpoint.regex.description: regular expression for matching file names

camel.source.endpoint.retainUncommitedDa.name: camel.source.endpoint.retainUncommitedData
camel.source.endpoint.retainUncommitedDa.description: Whether or not uncommitted data is to be retained after the operation

camel.source.endpoint.serviceClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.serviceClient
camel.source.endpoint.serviceClient.description: datalake service client for azure storage datalake

camel.source.endpoint.sharedKeyCredentia.name: camel.source.endpoint.sharedKeyCredential
camel.source.endpoint.sharedKeyCredentia.description: shared key credential for azure datalake gen2

camel.source.endpoint.userPrincipalNameR.name: camel.source.endpoint.userPrincipalNameReturned
camel.source.endpoint.userPrincipalNameR.description: whether or not to use upn

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.b.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.b.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.a.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.a.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
